definitions: soft white limestone substance formed into sticks for writing on blackboards
powdered magnesium carbonate used by rock climbers and gymnasts to improve grip
examples: The teacher wrote the math equation on the board with chalk
We need to buy more colored chalk for the classroom
She applied chalk to her hands before attempting the difficult climbing route
The gymnast's chalk bag fell off during her routine

definitions: large flat dark surface typically made of slate used for writing with chalk
examples: The professor filled the entire chalkboard with complex equations
Someone needs to clean the chalkboard before the next class
The old school still uses traditional chalkboards instead of whiteboards
She drew a beautiful diagram on the chalkboard to explain the concept

definitions: person who competes against others especially for a title or position
someone who disputes or questions established ideas, authority, or decisions
examples: The young boxer was considered a serious challenger for the heavyweight title
Several challengers emerged to compete for the championship
She became a vocal challenger of the company's environmental policies
The scientist was a persistent challenger of conventional theories

definitions: small tropical lizard with ability to change skin color to match surroundings
person who changes their behavior or opinions to suit different situations
examples: The chameleon slowly changed from green to brown on the tree branch
We spotted a tiny chameleon hiding among the leaves
He's such a political chameleon, always changing his stance to please voters
She was a social chameleon who could fit in with any group

definitions: informal term for champion or winner in sports or competition
act of biting or chewing something noisily and impatiently
examples: The boxing champ defended his title for the fifth time
Everyone wanted to meet the new chess champ
The horse was champing at the bit, eager to start racing
He champed on his cigar while waiting for the results

definitions: sparkling white wine produced in Champagne region of France or similar wines made elsewhere
examples: They opened a bottle of champagne to celebrate their anniversary
The champagne bubbles tickled her nose as she took a sip
We ordered champagne for the midnight toast on New Year's Eve
The wedding reception featured expensive French champagne

definitions: high-ranking government official often serving as head of government in some countries
chief administrative officer of a university or head of certain educational institutions
examples: The German chancellor announced new economic policies at the summit
She served as chancellor for twelve years before retiring
The university chancellor presided over the graduation ceremony
Students protested outside the chancellor's office about tuition increases

definitions: office, position, or term of service of a chancellor in government or education
examples: His chancellorship was marked by significant economic reforms
She achieved many educational improvements during her chancellorship
The university flourished under her ten-year chancellorship
He wrote a memoir about his experiences during the chancellorship

definitions: ornate hanging light fixture with multiple branches holding lights or candles suspended from ceiling
examples: The crystal chandelier sparkled in the ballroom's elegant atmosphere
They carefully cleaned each piece of the antique chandelier
A massive chandelier hung from the theater's painted ceiling
The chandelier swayed gently during the minor earthquake

definitions: process of changing from one system, method, or situation to another different one
examples: The changeover to the new computer system took several weeks
We experienced some problems during the changeover period
The factory shutdown allowed for a smooth changeover to automated production
Players switch sides at the changeover in tennis matches

definitions: mechanical device that automatically changes something such as records, CDs, or money
person who makes changes or exchanges one thing for another
examples: The old jukebox had a mechanical record changer inside
Insert coins into the money changer to get quarters
She worked as a money changer at the currency exchange booth
He was known as a game changer in the tech industry

definitions: words or phrases repeated rhythmically often by a crowd or group
simple melodic singing especially in religious services using limited musical range
examples: The protesters kept up their chant for hours outside the building
The crowd broke into a victory chant after the game
The monks' morning chant echoed through the monastery halls
She learned the ancient Sanskrit chant from her yoga teacher

definitions: person who sings or recites chants especially in religious contexts
pipe on a bagpipe that plays the melody with finger holes
examples: The lead chanter guided the congregation through the evening prayers
Buddhist chanters filled the temple with their rhythmic voices
He carefully cleaned the chanter of his Scottish bagpipes
The chanter produces the main melody while the drones provide harmony

definitions: act of singing or speaking words or sounds in a repetitive rhythmic way often in groups
examples: The chanting of the crowd grew louder as the team scored
Peaceful chanting filled the air during the meditation retreat
The rhythmic chanting helped the workers maintain their pace
Religious chanting has been practiced for thousands of years

definitions: informal British term for a man or boy often used in friendly way
crack or roughness in skin caused by cold weather or excessive dryness
examples: He's a decent chap who always helps his neighbors
The old chap at the corner store knows everyone's name
The cold winter wind caused painful chaps on her lips
Use moisturizer to prevent chaps on your hands

definitions: small building or room used for Christian worship often part of a larger institution
examples: The hospital chapel provided a quiet space for prayer and reflection
They got married in the small chapel on campus
The historic chapel dates back to the 14th century
Students gathered in the school chapel for morning assembly

definitions: adult who accompanies and supervises young people at social events to ensure proper behavior
examples: Parent volunteers served as chaperones for the school dance
The chaperone made sure all students returned to their rooms by curfew
We need more chaperones for the upcoming field trip
Her aunt acted as chaperone during her first few dates

definitions: member of clergy attached to military unit, institution, or private chapel providing spiritual guidance
examples: The hospital chaplain comforted families in the waiting room
She served as a military chaplain for ten years
The prison chaplain led weekly religious services for inmates
The school chaplain offered counseling to troubled students

definitions: position, office, or department of a chaplain within an institution or organization
examples: He accepted a chaplaincy position at the local university
The hospital's chaplaincy department serves patients of all faiths
She completed her training for military chaplaincy last year
The chaplaincy program provides spiritual support to students

definitions: partially burned or blackened material resulting from incomplete combustion
British term for person employed to clean houses or offices
cold-water fish similar to salmon found in northern lakes
examples: The fire left char marks on the kitchen ceiling
They found pieces of char in the abandoned campfire
The office char arrives early each morning to clean
She worked as a char to support her family
Fresh char is considered a delicacy in Alpine restaurants
They caught several char during their fishing trip

definitions: British spelling of characterization describing how characters are presented in literature or drama
examples: The author's characterisation of the villain was particularly compelling
Critics praised the film's subtle characterisation
Her characterisation of Lady Macbeth won several awards
The novel lacks depth in its characterisation of minor characters

definitions: process of creating and describing characters in literature, drama, or film including their traits and motivations
examples: The playwright's characterization brought each role to vivid life
Strong characterization is essential for engaging storytelling
The actor studied the script carefully to understand his character's characterization
Critics noted the shallow characterization of the supporting cast

definitions: elaborate pretense or deceptive act intended to hide the truth
party game where players act out words or phrases for others to guess
examples: Their happy marriage was just a charade for public appearances
He maintained the charade of being wealthy despite his debts
We played charades at the birthday party last night
She was excellent at charades, guessing every phrase correctly

definitions: black carbon residue from heated wood used for fuel, drawing, or filtering
dark gray color resembling the shade of charcoal
examples: Artists use charcoal sticks to create dramatic black and white drawings
We need more charcoal for the weekend barbecue
She wore a charcoal suit to the business meeting
The charcoal sky threatened rain all afternoon

definitions: leafy green vegetable with colorful stems related to beets also called Swiss chard
examples: She sautéed rainbow chard with garlic for a healthy side dish
The garden produced beautiful red and yellow chard this year
Fresh chard from the farmer's market tastes better than store-bought
Add chopped chard to soups for extra nutrition

definitions: device that supplies electrical power to recharge batteries in phones or other electronics
large flat plate used for serving food or as decorative base under dinner plates
historical term for strong horse used in battle or tournaments
examples: Don't forget to pack your phone charger for the trip
The laptop charger stopped working and needs replacement
The caterer arranged appetizers on silver chargers
Each place setting included an decorative charger under the dinner plate
The knight's charger was trained for combat
Medieval paintings often depicted warriors on their chargers

definitions: two-wheeled horse-drawn vehicle used in ancient warfare and racing
examples: The Roman chariot races drew huge crowds to the Colosseum
Archaeologists discovered remains of an ancient Egyptian chariot
The museum display includes a reconstructed Greek chariot
Ben-Hur featured an famous chariot race scene

definitions: person who drives a chariot especially in ancient races or warfare
examples: The skilled charioteer won many races in ancient Rome
Egyptian tomb paintings often depicted the pharaoh as a charioteer
The charioteer struggled to control his horses around the turn
Famous charioteers were celebrities in the ancient world

definitions: special magnetic charm or appeal that inspires devotion and attracts others naturally
examples: The politician's natural charisma helped her win the election
His charisma made him a successful motivational speaker
She had the kind of charisma that lit up any room
Leadership requires more than just charisma to be effective

definitions: person who falsely claims to have special knowledge or skills to deceive others
examples: The supposed psychic was exposed as a charlatan preying on grief
Many charlatans claim to have miracle cures for serious diseases
The art world is full of charlatans selling fake masterpieces
He was revealed to be a charlatan with no medical training

definitions: cold dessert made with fruit and bread or ladyfingers molded in a dish
common female given name of French origin
examples: The chef prepared a delicious apple charlotte for dessert
Strawberry charlotte is a classic summer treat
Charlotte was named after her grandmother
Princess Charlotte is fourth in line to the British throne

definitions: person who uses charm to influence or attract others often with romantic intent
examples: He was quite the charmer at social gatherings
The snake charmer performed for tourists in the market
She recognized him as a charmer who couldn't be trusted
That little boy is a real charmer with his smile

definitions: bright yellow-green color named after the liqueur
French herbal liqueur made by Carthusian monks in green or yellow varieties
examples: She painted the accent wall in a bold chartreuse color
The chartreuse dress stood out at the fashion show
They served chartreuse as an after-dinner digestif
The monastery still produces authentic chartreuse liqueur

definitions: mild drink consumed immediately after strong alcohol to cleanse the palate
person or thing that chases or pursues someone or something
examples: He ordered a beer chaser after his shot of whiskey
Lime juice makes a good chaser for tequila
The storm chaser followed tornadoes to study them
Police chasers sped after the fleeing suspect

definitions: deep crack or opening in earth's surface such as a gorge or abyss
profound difference or gap between people, opinions, or situations
examples: The earthquake created a dangerous chasm in the mountain road
They carefully crossed the narrow bridge over the chasm
There's a growing chasm between rich and poor in society
The chasm between their political views seemed impossible to bridge

definitions: base frame of a motor vehicle that holds the body and mechanical parts
examples: The mechanic inspected the car's chassis for rust damage
This truck has a reinforced chassis for heavy loads
The racing car's lightweight chassis improved its speed
Engineers designed a new chassis for the electric vehicle

definitions: state of abstaining from sexual activity or quality of being pure in thought and conduct
examples: Medieval knights took vows of chastity along with other oaths
Some religious orders require lifelong chastity from members
The concept of chastity varies across different cultures
Victorian society placed great emphasis on female chastity

definitions: large French country house or castle often associated with wine-producing estates
examples: They toured several chateaux in the Loire Valley
The wedding reception was held at a beautiful chateau
This wine comes from a famous Bordeaux chateau
The chateau has been in the family for centuries

definitions: continuous rapid informal talk about unimportant matters
rapid clicking sound made by teeth when cold or mechanical parts vibrating
examples: The constant chatter in the cafeteria made it hard to concentrate
Her nervous chatter filled every silence in the conversation
His teeth began to chatter in the freezing weather
The machine's chatter indicated something was loose

definitions: act of talking rapidly and continuously often about trivial matters or making rapid sounds
examples: The chattering of excited students filled the hallway
Squirrels were chattering loudly in the oak tree
Her constant chattering during the movie annoyed other viewers
The chattering of his teeth revealed how cold he was

definitions: person employed to drive a private car for someone else especially luxury vehicles
examples: The chauffeur opened the limousine door for the celebrity
She hired a chauffeur for her wedding day transportation
The hotel provides a chauffeur service to the airport
He worked as a chauffeur for wealthy families

definitions: excessive or prejudiced loyalty to one's country, group, or cause
belief that men are superior to women often called male chauvinism
examples: His nationalism crossed the line into dangerous chauvinism
Cultural chauvinism prevents people from appreciating other societies
The company's culture of chauvinism led to discrimination lawsuits
Male chauvinism was more openly expressed in past decades

definitions: person who acts dishonestly to gain advantage especially in games, tests, or relationships
examples: The teacher caught the cheater copying answers during the exam
Online games have systems to detect and ban cheaters
She discovered her boyfriend was a cheater through text messages
Nobody wants to play cards with a known cheater

definitions: act of behaving dishonestly to gain unfair advantage in exams, games, or relationships
examples: Cheating on exams can result in academic suspension
The scandal revealed widespread cheating in professional sports
She ended the relationship after discovering his cheating
Cheating at cards will get you banned from the casino

definitions: person who examines or verifies something especially at store checkout
flat round piece used in the game of checkers
one square in a checkered pattern of alternating colors
examples: The quality checker inspected each product before shipping
The grocery checker scanned items quickly
She moved her checker diagonally across the board
He kinged his checker when it reached the opposite end
The floor had a black and white checker pattern
Each checker on the board was carefully painted

definitions: square board with alternating colored squares used for checkers or chess
examples: They set up the checkerboard for their evening game
The kitchen floor resembled a giant checkerboard
She painted a checkerboard pattern on the table
The fields looked like a checkerboard from the airplane

definitions: written list of items to be checked, completed, or remembered in systematic order
examples: The pilot went through the pre-flight checklist carefully
She made a checklist of things to pack for vacation
The surgery checklist helps prevent medical errors
Complete every item on the checklist before submitting

definitions: position in chess where opponent's king is in immediate capture with no escape possible
examples: She announced checkmate in just fifteen moves
The grandmaster saw checkmate coming three moves ahead
He studied famous checkmate patterns to improve his game
The unexpected checkmate surprised even experienced players
